title: Directed Readings in Theological Studies
description: The scope, focus and requirements of a reading course are determined by the professor in consultation with the student. Permission for a reading course must be obtained at the time of registration, prior to the term in which the course will be conducted.

title: Thinking Theologically
description: An advanced introduction to the classical themes in Christian theology, with attention to the nature of theological argumentation, and the significance of social location in the practice of theology.

title: The Mennonite Tradition in Historical Context
description: This is an examination of the historical emergence and development of the Mennonite tradition within the larger context of the Church.

title: The Radical Reformation
description: A study of Anabaptism and its place in the history of the Christian Church and of the Reformation period.

title: Supervised Experience in Ministry I
description: This course explores ministry in a practical setting.  A ten hour per week placement will be chosen by the student with the approval of the Applied Studies Coordinator.  With the guidance of a local supervisor, the student will set learning goals, develop a reading list, and write a summative paper that will be shared with other students taking this course.
requirementsDescription: Prereq: TS 677 and at least two core courses.

title: Supervised Experience in Ministry II
description: This course explores ministry in a practical setting.  A ten hour per week placement will be chosen by the student with the approval of the applied studies coordinator.  With the guidance of a local supervisor, the student will set learning goals, develop a reading list, and write a summative paper that will be shared with other students taking this course.

title: Aging and the Spiritual Life
description: Through experiential, reflective and theorectial learning, this course will explore spirituality as a central aspect of growth and development in later life.  The perspectives of various faith and humanistic traditions will be included.  Topics will include: religious beliefs and spiritual concerns later in life; a theology of aging; ministry to persons in later life; spirituality and dementia; death and dying.

title: Seminars in Theological Studies
description: Course topics and instructors will be announced each term.

title: Explorations in Theological Studies
description: This course provides a framework for students to pursue specialized topics by completing courses which may be available off-campus or on-line.

title: Special Topics in New Testament Exegesis
description: This course uses a variety of methods of analysis and interpretation of biblical texts to conduct a close reading of a New Testament book.  Students may be given permission to take the course repeatedly, given that focus and content changes each time offered.

title: Studying the New Testament
description: A study of the literary genres, history of composition, and canonization of the New Testament.  The course will examine various methodological approaches to the New Testament, including their implications for Christian theological interpretation.

title: Thesis Preparation
description: Students are enrolled in thesis research and writing.  Students continue to enroll in this course during thesis preparation until completion of their thesis.

title: Thesis Preparation
description: Students are enrolled in thesis research writing.  Students continue to enroll in this course during thesis preparation until completion of their thesis.
